subject: Business
title: The Nibble: Small Asks After Agreement
description: A quick win: understand The Nibble: Small Asks After Agreement.

hook.text: You agree on the car price. Then the buyer says: 'You'll throw in floor mats, right?' Most sellers say yes.

buildup.text: The nibble is a small, last-minute request made after the main deal is done.

discovery.text: It works because the other side is psychologically committed. Saying no to a small ask feels petty.

twist.text: Each nibble is small alone, but they add up. Repeat nibbles erode the deal's value significantly.

climax.text: The defense: 'I'd be happy to discuss that â€” let's reopen the full agreement.' That stops nibbles fast.

punchline.text: Small asks at the end aren't small. They're strategy.

quiz.question: Why are nibbles effective after a deal is agreed?
options: The other side is committed and reluctant to reopen the deal over a small ask
They are legally required to accept minor additions
Nibbles are only used in car sales
